headline: Jobs Report, CPI Data: What to Watch This Week
summary: This week will bring a deluge of U.S. economic indicators, particularly jobs and inflation reports stalled by the recent government shutdown. Investors also will navigate more earnings reports flowing in and a slate of Federal Reserve appearances to gauge the central bank's path amid persistent economic uncertainty.

content.title: Jobs Report, CPI Data: What to Watch This Week
content.summary: This week will bring a deluge of U.S. economic indicators, particularly jobs and inflation reports stalled by the recent government shutdown. Investors also will navigate more earnings reports flowing in and a slate of Federal Reserve appearances to gauge the central bank's path amid persistent economic uncertainty.

headline: How Recent Analyst Shifts Are Reshaping The Apollo Tyres (NSEI:APOLLOTYRE) Story
summary: Apollo Tyres has seen its fair value estimate adjusted to ₹562.71 from ₹569.33, alongside a modest cut in the discount rate to 14.51% from 15.11% and a slightly higher revenue growth input of 7.19% from 6.93%. These moves line up with recent Street research that fine tunes targets across the broader Apollo group, combining ongoing confidence in execution with a more measured view on risk and return. Read on to see how you can keep on top of these evolving assumptions and the changing...

headline: Apollo Global Management Profit Falls, Revenue Rises
summary: Apollo Global Management’s fourth-quarter profit fell as higher tax provision and an investment-activities loss outweighed strong revenue gains and higher quarterly inflows.

headline: Apollo, xAI near $3.4 billion deal to fund AI chips, The Information reports
summary: Apollo Global Management is close to finalizing a roughly $3.4 billion loan to an investment vehicle that plans to ​buy Nvidia chips and lease them to Elon Musk's xAI, The ‌Information reported on Monday, citing a person familiar with the matter.  Less than a week ago, ‌Musk announced that SpaceX acquired the artificial intelligence company he also leads in a deal that values the rocket and satellite company at $1 trillion and the AI outfit at $250 billion.  Musk has said the rationale behind combining SpaceX ⁠and xAI is partly to ‌advance the development of orbital data centers, which could use space-based infrastructure to support next-generation AI computing.

content.title: Apollo, xAI near $3.4 billion deal to fund AI chips, The Information reports
content.summary: Apollo Global Management is close to finalizing a roughly $3.4 billion loan to an investment vehicle that plans to ​buy Nvidia chips and lease them to Elon Musk's xAI, The ‌Information reported on Monday, citing a person familiar with the matter.  Less than a week ago, ‌Musk announced that SpaceX acquired the artificial intelligence company he also leads in a deal that values the rocket and satellite company at $1 trillion and the AI outfit at $250 billion.  Musk has said the rationale behind combining SpaceX ⁠and xAI is partly to ‌advance the development of orbital data centers, which could use space-based infrastructure to support next-generation AI computing.

thumbnail.caption: FILE PHOTO: Illustration shows 3D-printed miniature model of Elon Musk and xAI logo

headline: Apollo Stock Rises on Earnings. It Needed Some Good News.
summary: Shares of  Apollo Global Management  rose Monday after the asset manager reported stronger-than-expected quarterly earnings.  Apollo reported adjusted earnings of $2.47 a share for the fourth quarter, ahead of analysts’ consensus estimate of $2.04, according to FactSet.  The company posted $1.24 billion in fee-related revenue, up 30% from last year, and reported a record $97 billion in deal origination activity.

content.title: Apollo Stock Rises on Earnings. It Needed Some Good News.
content.summary: Shares of  Apollo Global Management  rose Monday after the asset manager reported stronger-than-expected quarterly earnings.  Apollo reported adjusted earnings of $2.47 a share for the fourth quarter, ahead of analysts’ consensus estimate of $2.04, according to FactSet.  The company posted $1.24 billion in fee-related revenue, up 30% from last year, and reported a record $97 billion in deal origination activity.

headline: Heard on the Street: How Apollo Is Riding Out the Private Credit Pullback
summary: Apollo Global Management is one of the most prominent faces of private credit.  Despite a surge of concern about private-asset firms’ exposure to software companies at risk of AI disruption, shares of Apollo are now basically flat so far in February.  Meanwhile, many of its peers are down sharply: Ares Management, Blackstone, Blue Owl, KKR & Co. and TPG are all off by at least 6% or more this month.

content.title: Heard on the Street: How Apollo Is Riding Out the Private Credit Pullback
content.summary: Apollo Global Management is one of the most prominent faces of private credit.  Despite a surge of concern about private-asset firms’ exposure to software companies at risk of AI disruption, shares of Apollo are now basically flat so far in February.  Meanwhile, many of its peers are down sharply: Ares Management, Blackstone, Blue Owl, KKR & Co. and TPG are all off by at least 6% or more this month.

headline: Apollo Stock Rises on Earnings. The Asset Manager Says Its Software Exposure Is Low.
summary: Shares of  Apollo Global Management  rose Monday after the asset manager reported stronger-than-expected quarterly earnings and tried to ease investors’ worries about its software investments.  Apollo reported adjusted earnings of $2.47 a share for the fourth quarter, ahead of analysts’ consensus estimate of $2.04, according to FactSet.  Investors’ concerns about artificial intelligence reducing the need for software solutions has weighed on alternative asset managers.

content.title: Apollo Stock Rises on Earnings. The Asset Manager Says Its Software Exposure Is Low.
content.summary: Shares of  Apollo Global Management  rose Monday after the asset manager reported stronger-than-expected quarterly earnings and tried to ease investors’ worries about its software investments.  Apollo reported adjusted earnings of $2.47 a share for the fourth quarter, ahead of analysts’ consensus estimate of $2.04, according to FactSet.  Investors’ concerns about artificial intelligence reducing the need for software solutions has weighed on alternative asset managers.

headline: Apollo Global Sets Lending Record
summary: Apollo Global Management set a record in its business of making loans. The firm originated a record $97 billion in the fourth quarter, totaling $309 billion for the year, almost $100 billion more than the year before. Allison McNeely has more on "Bloomberg Open Interest."

content.title: Apollo Global Sets Lending Record
content.description: Apollo Global Management set a record in its business of making loans. The firm originated a record $97 billion in the fourth quarter, totaling $309 billion for the year, almost $100 billion more than the year before. Allison McNeely has more on "Bloomberg Open Interest."

summary: Marc Rowan, CEO of Apollo Global Management. Patrick T. Fallon/Getty Images Apollo Global Management on Monday announced a strategic partnership with UK-based asset manager Schroders, the private equity firm’s latest effort to bring private-market investments to everyday investors. headline: Clear Channel Outdoor Holdings, Inc. Agrees to be Acquired by Mubadala Capital, in Partnership with TWG Global, for $6.2 Billion
summary: Clear Channel Outdoor Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: CCO) ("Clear Channel" or the "Company"), a leader in U.S. out-of-home (OOH) advertising, today announced that it has entered into a definitive agreement to be acquired by Mubadala Capital, in partnership with TWG Global ("TWG"). The all-cash transaction values Clear Channel at an enterprise value of $6.2 billion.

content.title: Clear Channel Outdoor Holdings, Inc. Agrees to be Acquired by Mubadala Capital, in Partnership with TWG Global, for $6.2 Billion
content.summary: Clear Channel Outdoor Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: CCO) ("Clear Channel" or the "Company"), a leader in U.S. out-of-home (OOH) advertising, today announced that it has entered into a definitive agreement to be acquired by Mubadala Capital, in partnership with TWG Global ("TWG"). The all-cash transaction values Clear Channel at an enterprise value of $6.2 billion.
